DOC.brief_summary: The investigator propose conduct pilot study identify 6 worksites ( 2 India , 2 Sri Lanka , 2 Bangladesh ) explore barrier optimum cardiovascular disease ( CVD ) care worksites , quantify risk factor level worksite population identify train peer mentor deliver educational intervention improve life style enhance medication adherence among moderate high risk cardiovascular disease ( CVD ) .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Peer-mentor Mediated Interventions Cardiovascular Risk Factors Worksites
DOC.detailed_description: Eligibility Criteria - All employee age 35 year select workplace . Study design - Mixed method method Phase 1 - Qualitative study ; Phase 2 - Quantitative - Single group , non-randomized before-after comparison study + KAP survey Sample size - Approximately 3000 participant . The study entail follow step - Step 1 - An evaluation knowledge , attitude practice ( KAP ) relate cardiovascular health/ disease worksites . Step 2 - A qualitative study barrier facilitator behavior associate optimal cardiovascular health Step 3 - Baseline assessment cardiovascular risk use non-lab base risk assessment score Step 4 - Piloting trained peer mentor educational/ intensive follow-up intervention 3 month re-assessment 3 month .

Will relocate study period . 5 . Unwilling unable comply study procedure .
